Entries.default:
"So now it comes to this, aimico."

Tugging on the frilled cuffs of his sleeves, Captain Furrante strolls confidently forward. With a flick of his hand, he signals to the posse of well-armed pirates behind him.
Entries.female:
"So now it comes to this, aimica."

Tugging on the frilled cuffs of his sleeves, Captain Furrante strolls confidently forward. With a flick of his hand, he signals to the posse of well-armed pirates behind him.

Entries.default: [Attack] "This is the end for you and your dreams."
"The Vailian Trading Company has a plan for Ukaizo, too. A profitable one for me."
"Rauatai is commandeering this land. Retreat or die."
"Can't we make a deal?"
"In that you are mistaken, aimico."
"Huana built this island. If it belongs to anyone it's them."

"You think to steal my golden dream. But I will not allow it to happen."

He embellishes an aristocratic bow as he draws arms against you.
"My gratitude is yours for disabling the storms. It seems I did not require Rivan's ship to reach Ukaizo, in the end."
"Really, you pirates are worse than cockroaches."
"Don't make me hurt you. Walk away while you still can."
"I care nothing for one's origins if it is not from Grand Vailia. Whatever the beginning of these ruins was, there is only one possible ending."
"Not for any reason would I leave the lost city of gold unplundered. If you do not believe that, you have never met a true pirate."
"Indeed, I had hoped myself to partner with the Trading Company. But that time has passed. As has yours."
"Not on your soul. I have waited for this, casità. For far too long."
"The Príncipi have adapted - no, thrived - for centuries. We survived the fall of the grandest empire Eora has ever known."
"You jest in the face of your death, ac? Allow me to admit how grandly I will enjoy ending you."
"Corès, casità. May your lungs fill so fully with blood that you choke even in Hel."
"Until the next life. Or perhaps not, considering."
"You may slaughter us now and then. But you can never stop us. We will ransom, thieve, and forge a future for our continued blood, long after you are but dust."
"Spoken like a true new blood."
[Shrug]
"Gods curse you! I should have drowned you in the wreckage of Port Maje." The muscles in his jaw flex as fury tightens his expression.
"Such memorable last words." He sighs heavily.
"Take no prisoners!"

"And you - you will die now for the greater good. Corès, casità. Give my regards to the gods."

He tips his hat in farewell, a surprisingly genteel gesture considering his plans to murder you.
"The lost city of gold will be the foundation of the future of the Príncipi."
